intro: Tanarius mauritianus, commonly known as the Mauritius tanarius, is a flowering plant native to the island of Mauritius. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
